Issues.Title: Adding routing breaks document.referrer functionality in IE 11
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Description In IE 11, when redirecting to angular apps with routing, `document.referrer` is empty (instead of sender) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 

!Works:
- In IE, open console and go to https://referrer-source.netlify.app/
- Click "Target Site" (redirects to https://referrer-target.netlify.app/)
- Check `document.referrer` value in console
- Returns ""

Works:
- In IE, open console and go to https://referrer-source.netlify.app/
- Click "Target Site -- No Routing" (redirects to https://referrer-target-simple.netlify.app/)
- Check `document.referrer` value in console
- Returns "https://referrer-source.netlify.app/"
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Node: 12.16.3
OS: win32 x64

Issues.Title: i18n with ivy breaks the injection of translated attribute
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/localize. ### Is this a regression? Yes, this issue is reproducible only with Ivy. With ViewEngine it works fine. ### Description Injecting the attribute to the component/directive that is translated using `i18n` is always resulting in `null`. Example: `text` is a directive that reads the `text` attribute and simply adds the following text to the host element: > Text attribtue value is: Code: ```html
``` Resulting HTML: ```html
Text attribtue value is: Text without i18n.
Text attribtue value is: null.
``` Observed in the result above, `text` attribute is properly set to `Text with i18n`, while the injected value remains `null`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-uzgvwe You can observe `null` as described above. To make this example work, open settings and uncheck `Enable Ivy`. Now ViewEngine will be used to compile the application, and the `null` text will be replaced by `Text with i18n`. ## üåç Your Environment Angular CLI: 10.0.4 Node: 12.16.3 OS: linux x64 Angular: 10.0.5 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router Ivy Workspace: Yes Package Version ----------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1000.4 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.1000.4 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer 0.1000.4 @angular-devkit/build-webpack 0.1000.4 @angular-devkit/core 10.0.4 @angular-devkit/schematics 10.0.4 @angular/cli 10.0.4 @ngtools/webpack 10.0.4 @schematics/angular 10.0.4 @schematics/update 0.1000.4 rxjs 6.5.5 typescript 3.9.7 webpack 4.43.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "i18n with ivy breaks the injection of translated attribute" (#38231)

Issues.Title: refactor(router): Adjust type of parameter in navigateByUrl and creat‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶eUrlTree to be more accurate

`router.navigateByUrl` and `router.createUrlTree` only use a subset of the `NavigationExtras`. This commit
changes the parameter type to pick only those properties which are used in the implementations.

Fixes #18798


BREAKING CHANGE: While the new parameter types allow a variable of type
`NavigationExtras` to be passed in, they will not allow object literals,
as they may only specify known properties. They will also not accept
types that do not have properties in common with the ones in the `Pick`.
To fix this error, only specify properties from the `NavigationExtras` which are
actually used in the respective function calls.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(router): Adjust type of parameter in navigateByUrl and creat‚Ä¶" (#38227)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): Add support for string literal class members
Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: Allow local WIP commits
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
This feature request is for dev-infra


### Description
Currently, [WIP commits are explicitly disallowed by commit validation](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9322b9a06040e3401377e2123691230e1e7e62e8/dev-infra/commit-message/validate.spec.ts#L131-L138). That makes sense for merged code, but is really annoying for local development. I often want to use `wip: does this thing` as a simple commit message which is good enough for me to remember the context of the commit and clean up the message later.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Allow `WIP` commit messages, at lest for local commits. We can have a separate test that runs on PRs to make sure these don't get submitted, while still being more usable.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Currently I think the best workaround is `--no-verify` or including a dummy commit message that fits the requirements. I never think to include `--no-verify`, and a lot of the time I'm using VSCode's commit functionality where I can't really specify that.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow local WIP commits" (#38225)

Issues.Title: Handle SwPush notification action without application running
Issues.Body:
### Relevant Package
@angular/service-worker

### Description
Feeling a bit bad to open this issue since it **must** have been discussed elsewhere but I just can't found it. I already described the issue on stackoverflow, too ([link](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63072347/handle-swpush-notification-action-without-application-running)).

All I'd like to achive is push notification action clicks being processed when the application is not running (e.g. sending the selected option back to the server). Relying on actions that only get executed when the application is running is no acceptable solution, that's why I think I must have missed something here. But if that really is the expected behavior this needs to change!


### Describe the solution you'd like
Since I guess it's not possible to bootstrap the whole application for executing the action (eventhough it should be somehow?) I should at least be able to set an endpoint getting called when the action is clicked and no application is running.

Also clicking the notification does not open the application - and there are only unclean solutions out there to work around it. It all feels a little bit "work in progess". Are there more features for SwPush in the pipeline?

Issues.Title: Running ngcc in postinstall. Angular CLI should not run as part of the build step
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report / feature request
This issue is a follow up to https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/35000

### Affected Package
@angular/compiler-cli

### Is this a regression?

Maybe - https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/35000

### Description

The advice in https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/35000#issuecomment-579123805 from @Toxicable  was to set up a postinstall hook like so:
> If you run ngcc yourself beforehand then the angular cli wont run it as part of it's build step.
> That should solve you issue of building multiple apps in parallel
```
"postinstall": "ngcc  --create-ivy-entry-points --properties es2015 browser module main",
```
**the angular cli wont run it as part of it's build step.** <- this is the key part I would expect to happen but it doesn't seem to be the case. as **I see ngcc being run in my build for every webpack build**
```
Another process, with id 44, is currently running ngcc.
--
5 | Waiting up to 25s for it to finish.
6 | Another process, with id 124, is currently running ngcc.
7 | Waiting up to 25s for it to finish.
8 | Another process, with id 44, is currently running ngcc.
9 | Waiting up to 25s for it to finish.
10 | Another process, with id 117, is currently running ngcc.
11 | Waiting up to 25s for it to finish.
12 | Another process, with id 58, is currently running ngcc.
13 | Waiting up to 25s for it to finish.
14 | Another process, with id 44, is currently running ngcc.
15 | Waiting up to 25s for it to finish.
```
Unfortunately when CI is busy with other work the max retries is used up and the build fails. We have about 10 parallel builds of different flavors of our Angular App so there is A LOT of parallelism going on.

Would it be possible to disable NGCC in ngtools/webpack builds when the dependencies have already been compiled before?  @Toxicable @petebacondarwin @AndrewKushnir @gkalpak

`Angular: 9.1.0`

Issues.Title: `RouterModule` directives cannot be tree shaken under Ivy
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> The issue is caused by package @angular/router

### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: View Engine

### Description

Directives in `RouterModule` cannot be tree shaken in Ivy builds. This is because of a circular dependency which requires the use of `setComponentScope()` to be used. `setComponentScope()` is inherently side-effectful, and is the compiler's way of working around circular dependencies, where it can not import the required dependencies to define a template scope without causing a cycle in the import graph.

The solution here is to remove the cycle, and the compiler will be able to generate code that does **not** use `setComponentScope()`. This should allow compilers like Closure to tree shake unused components in `RouterModule`.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Import something from `RouterModule` (such as `RouterLink`). In the output bundle (at least for Closure, I didn't check Terser) it will include `RouterLinkActive`, despite the fact that it was not actually used in the application.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:** `master`

**Anything else relevant?**
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èIs this a browser specific issue? If so, please specify the browser and version. -->

<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èDo any of these matter: operating system, IDE, package manager, HTTP server, ...? If so, please mention it below. -->

Spin off from #38211. I was able to generate a circular dependency list by patching #38210, this is the dependency chain which needs to be broken:

```
/home/dparker/Source/ng/packages/router/src/components/empty_outlet.ts
/home/dparker/Source/ng/packages/router/src/directives/router_outlet.ts
/home/dparker/Source/ng/packages/router/src/config.ts
/home/dparker/Source/ng/packages/router/src/components/empty_outlet.ts
```

Also see http://b/162019906 for more investigative information.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`RouterModule` directives cannot be tree shaken under Ivy" (#38212)

Issues.Title: Warn or error when `setComponentScope()` is necessary
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/compiler


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> When an `NgModule` includes components/directives/pipes with circular references, the scope for Angular components cannot be determined, as creating the relevant imports would cause a cycle that would fail Closure compilations. To work around this, the compiler defers this task to run time with `setComponentScope()`, effective setting the component template to use the entire module as a scope. This is a deoptimization which comes from a circular reference in source code. Missing this optimization means that tree shaking is less effective. For example, `RouterModule` appears to generate `setComponentScope()` and as a result, `routerLinkActive` can not be tree shaken even if it is never used.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> The compiler should warn or error when such a case occurs (probably only if the user set a particular flag). This would allow performance sensitive code (such as `@angular/core`) to restrict itself to not include circular references to allow better tree shaking. Ideally this would print out the full path of the cycle so users could attempt to fix it.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Currently the best workaround is to grep output deobfuscated code for `setComponentScope()` and identify the modules it was used with. You then just have to "figure out" exactly how the circular dependency was introduced and what the best way of fixing it is.

I made https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/38210, which is a patch to the compiler which prints out any cycled identified and then fails the build. This is a hacky means of figuring out exactly what cycle is causing `setComponentScope()`. For `RouterModule` this prints:

```
/home/dparker/Source/ng/packages/router/src/components/empty_outlet.ts
/home/dparker/Source/ng/packages/router/src/directives/router_outlet.ts
/home/dparker/Source/ng/packages/router/src/config.ts
/home/dparker/Source/ng/packages/router/src/components/empty_outlet.ts
```

Also see http://b/162019906 for more investigative information.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Warn or error when `setComponentScope()` is necessary" (#38211)

Issues.Title: Detect and print cycles that cause `setComponentScope()` to be used
Issues.Body:
This detects and prints any cycles which cause `setComponentScope()` to be used and deoptimize tree-shakeability.

This patch serves as a work-around for #38211.

Issues.Title: Share identical stylesheets between components in the same file
Issues.Body:
In rare cases, multiple components can share the same styles. For example, Material does this with `MatButton` and `MatAnchor`.

View Engine had a feature which converted `styleUrls` into `.ngstyle.js` classes with exported constants, and thus naturally deduplicated reuse of external stylesheets. Ivy does not perform this optimization by design - it was a design goal to remove all additional "shim" files.

A limited form of this optimization in Ivy is possible - within a single file, it should be possible to use the `ConstantPool` to deduplicate stylesheet text that is shared between multiple components. This would be useful both for external stylesheets as well as inline style text, as long as it's identical. This optimization is of course conditional on `ViewEncapsulation` - encapsulated and un-encapsulated styles will have different contents, and thus no reuse between them is possible.

This optimization would apply to the Material example above, since `MatButton` and `MatAnchor` are both declared in the same TS file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue " Share identical stylesheets between components in the same file" (#38204)

| [css-loader](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader) | devDependencies | major | [`3.5.2` -> `4.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/css-loader/3.5.2/4.0.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack-contrib/css-loader</summary>

### [`v4.0.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​400-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribcss-loadercomparev360v400-2020-07-25)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/compare/v3.6.0...v4.0.0)

##### ‚ö† BREAKING CHANGES

-   minimum required `Node.js` version is `10.13.0`
-   minimum required `webpack` version is `4.27.0`
-   the `esModule` option is `true` by default
-   default value of the `sourceMap` option depends on the `devtool` option
-   `icss` plugin disable by default, you need to setup the `modules` option to enable it
-   the `modules` option is `true` by default for all files matching `/\.module\.\w+$/i.test(filename)` regular expression, `module.auto` is `true` by default
-   the `modules.context` option was renamed to the `modules.localIdentContext` option
-   default the `modules.localIdentContext` value is `compiler.context` for the `module.getLocalIdent` option
-   the `modules.hashPrefix` option was renamed to the `modules.localIdentHashPrefix` option
-   the `localsConvention` option was moved and renamed to the `modules.exportLocalsConvention` option
-   the `getLocalIndent` option should be always `Function` and should always return `String` value
-   the `onlyLocals` option was moved and renamed to the `modules.exportOnlyLocals` option
-   function arguments of the `import` option were changed, it is now `funciton(url, media, resourcePath) {}`
-   inline syntax was changed, please write `~` before the file request, i.e. rewrite `url(~!!loader!package/img.png)` to `url(!!loader!~package/img.png)`

##### Features

-   `@value` supports importing `url()` ([#​1126](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/issues/1126)) ([7f49a0a](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/commit/7f49a0a6047846bb2e432558365e19d4a0dfb366))
-   improve `url()` resolving algorithm ([bc19ddd](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/commit/bc19ddd8779dafbc2a420870a3cb841041ce9c7c))
-   named export for locals ([#​1108](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/issues/1108)) ([d139ec1](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/commit/d139ec1d763f9944550b31f2a75183e488dd1224))
-   respected the `style` field from package.json ([#​1099](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/issues/1099)) ([edf5347](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/commit/edf5347e4203a62e50b87248a83da198afdc6eba))
-   support `file:` protocol ([5604205](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/commit/560420567eb0e1a635648b7f4ff0365db475384c))
-   support server relative URLs

##### Bug Fixes

-   resolution algorithm, you don't need `~` inside packages in `node_modules` ([76f1480](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/css-loader/commit/76f1480b14265369ac5dc8dbbce467cfb8e814c5))

</details>

### [`v4.44.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.44.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.43.0...v4.44.0)

### Features

-   Improve `sideEffects` flag behavior when dynamic modules are part of the tree
    -   Fixes a bug which causes empty modules (or type-only modules) to "break" Tree Shaking
-   add `splitChunks.enforceSizeThreshold` to allow enfore splitting larger chunks unrelated from other limiations
    -   Not set by default to avoid breaking change
    -   It will be set by default to 50k in webpack 5
    -   It's recommended to set it in webpack 4 too
-   add support for `resolve.roots` and default `resolve.roots: [context]`
    -   This allows to resolve server-relative urls (e.g. `/src/abc`) to the project root (or other locations when configured)
    -   This allows to use loaders that rely on that behavior

### Bugfixes

-   fix bug where splitChunks produced non-optimal results when `minSize` is set to `0`
    -   This lead to `NaN`s in some places which breaks ordering
-   Fix bug which lead to HMR not working for splitChunks in entrypoints
-   force update watchpack and chokidar for chokidar bugfix which causes files to stop being watched

### [`v4.43.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.43.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.42.1...v4.43.0)

### Features

-   add `module.hot.invalidate()` to HMR API

### Dependencies

-   push versions for forced security updates

</details>

Issues.Title: Option to build without emiting files
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
- [x] build

### Description
To test to see if a project would build, I have to actually build it fully. This takes around a minute. Since I wish to automatically test that my schematic outputs valid code, I don't need code to be generated, merely know if the code compiles. Thus, I want to only execute the first stages of the angular compilation process.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Add a commandline flag to build which prevents it from outputting any code. For similarity with typescript, I would call it `--noEmit`, after the typescript flag which does the same thing.

Thus,
```
ng build --noEmit
```
would run all stages of compilation up to the point where it is clear that the code will successfully build. This would be the parsing and typechecking phases most likely, though I am not familiar enough with the angular compiler to know for sure

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I thought maybe `ng lint --type-check`  would do what I want. However, `ng lint --type-check` does not catch type errors. 

I could build a system which watches the output of the angular builder and then kills the process as soon as it enters the code generation phase. However, this seems a kludgy solution. 

Adding '"noEmit":true' to `tsconfig.base.json` suppresses the typescript generation, thereby saving ~30s of the ~60s build time, but angular cares on its marry way attempting to bundle anyway, leading to the console filling with erroneous warnings of unnecessary files included in the build. While the best alternatives  I have found, it seems that suppressing output on an angular level would still be superior as this would save even more time, and cause no erroneous warnings.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Option to build without emiting files" (#18369)

Issues.Title: build: minor fixes for google3 sync
Issues.Body:
This commit makes a few minor changes to enable syncing the CLI repository
into google3.

1. mark pkg_tar and pkg_npm as external
2. remove dependencies (marked as comment) which are stale in google3
3. add code fence for TS files generated from JSON schema in BUILD files
    since these files are compiled and added to the g3 codebase at sync time
4. Some minor typing changes
5. Remove duplicate licenses
6. mark dependencies which are not available in g3 as external
7. Immediately type the result of JSON.parse() as required by g3 linter.
   Otherwise, the type defaults to `any`.

Issues.Title: Stop leaking pathnames in generated files
Issues.Body:
After `ng build`, some of the generated files contain folder names from my computer.
Something like this:

````js
module.exports = __webpack_require__(/*! /home/my/username/my/projects/something/src/main.ts */"./src/main.ts");
````

I've noticed this in the following files:

* styles.js
* polyfill.js
* main.js

For developers that wish to remain anonymous, this can be an important issue. Is there some flag to prevent this? Also it would be nice to either have this off by default, or have a hint in the generated comment about how to turn it off.

Issues.Title: ES7 Object Rest Operator to Omit Properties fails in prod mode
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Is this a regression? No ### Description It's easier to explain with the sample code. Say we have an object with a bunch of fields and you want to clone the object but exclude a couple of properties. We'd traditionally write: ```js const clone = Object.assign({}, originalObject); delete clone.field; ``` With ES7 we can write: ```js const { field, ...clone} = originalObject; ``` It works perfectly in dev mode. However, in prod mode, code is minified and the above code is minified to: ```js const {...clone} = originalObject; ``` So the property is not removed from the object and the code is broken. Maybe it's not an angular issue, but it took me a while to figure out what was the problem and why it worked in dev mode, but failed in prod mode. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [Link to the repo with repro app](https://github.com/dima716/repro-app) Just run ```ng serve``` and then ```ng serve --prod``` and compare the results. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 8.3.29
Node: 12.16.2
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 8.2.14
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.803.29
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.803.29
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.803.29
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.803.29
@angular-devkit/core              8.3.29
@angular-devkit/schematics        8.3.29
@angular/cli                      8.3.29
@ngtools/webpack                  8.3.29
@schematics/angular               8.3.29
@schematics/update                0.803.29
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.5.3
webpack                           4.39.2

[`042c4a2`](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/commit/042c4a23) - chore: mark 5.2.0-post ([#​6240](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/issues/6240))

### [`v5.2.0`](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/releases/v5.2.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/compare/v5.1.0...v5.2.0)

#### Feature changes

The experimental API for registering custom query handlers is slightly changed such that one registers query handlers containing two strategies: one for querying a single element and one for querying all matching elements.

The API for custom query handlers is unchanged:

```ts
__experimental_registerCustomQueryHandler(name: string, queryHandler: QueryHandler): void;
__experimental_unregisterCustomQueryHandler(name: string): void;
__experimental_customQueryHandlers(): Map<string, QueryHandler>;
__experimental_clearQueryHandlers(): void;
```

but QueryHandler is now defined as:

```ts
export interface QueryHandler {
  queryOne?: (element: Element | Document, selector: string) => Element | null;
  queryAll?: (element: Element | Document, selector: string) => Element[] | NodeListOf<Element>;
}
```

#### Bug fixes and improvements

-   The ESM build now includes file extensions in its import statements to match the ESM spec. _Note that the ESM build is still considered experimental and should not be relied on._
-   The docs on running Firefox Nightly are now much clearer.
-   We now vendor in common dependencies such as Mitt so they can be used more easily outside of the Node module resolution ecosystem.

#### Raw notes

[`313774c`](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/commit/313774c5) - feat: change QueryHandler to contain QueryOne and QueryAll methods ([#​6218](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/issues/6218))
[`82645e8`](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/commit/82645e85) - docs: better describe how to install Firefox Nightly with Puppeteer ([#​6226](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/issues/6226))
[`f1a6b8d`](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/commit/f1a6b8d6) - chore: vendor Mitt & update project structure ([#​6209](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/issues/6209))
[`fb80610`](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/commit/fb806109) - docs(troubleshooting): drops obsolete dependencies ([#​5354](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/issues/5354))

### [`v5.1.0`](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/releases/v5.1.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/compare/v5.0.0...v5.1.0)

#### Highlights:

The new [`Mouse#wheel`](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/blob/main/docs/api.md#mousewheeloptions) API has been merged in [#​6141](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/issues/6141). It behaves similar to other mouse commands like up or down and therefore requires a `mouse.move(x, y)` for targeting the element properly.

Issues.Title: bug(COMPONENT): TITLE Sticky does not stick in Angular 10
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

We thought we had this solved here: https://github.com/angular/components/issues/19872

The stackblitz solution does not work in Angular 10. I reproduced the issue here:

https://github.com/fireflysemantics/mat-table-sticky

I can't do a Stackblitz, because it has to have an Angular 10 environment to be reproduced.

The rest of the issue is documented here:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63082745/getting-sticky-to-stick-without-sliding-over-in-angular-material-data-table

And here:

https://github.com/angular/components/issues/19872
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(COMPONENT): TITLE Sticky does not stick in Angular 10" (#20094)

Issues.Body: Adds test harnesses for the stepper-related components.

Issues.Title: feat(MatTooltip): Mimic native tooltip behaviour
Issues.Body: #### Feature Description ##### If nested elements have `MatTooltip`s applied on them, show the innermost tooltip. Suppose we have a button with a span inside it. ```html ``` If both of these elements have the title attribute applied to them and we hover the span, the browser shows title text of the span. However, if we use the `MatTooltip` directive, both tooltips are shown to the user. [Minimal Reproduction on StackBlitz](https://mat-tooltip-vs-native-tooltip.stackblitz.io) #### Use Case Whenever you need to show different tooltips for parent and child elements.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(MatTooltip): Mimic native tooltip behaviour" (#20091)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-select): selected options removed when filtering and selecting options
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/mat-select-filtered

Steps to reproduce:
1. Select 1+ options
2. Search for an option which is not selected
3. Select the option 
4. Clear search
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Previous selected options are kept


#### Actual Behavior

Previous selected options are not selected anymore


#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.1
- CDK/Material: 10.1.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-select): selected options removed when filtering and selecting options" (#20090)

Issues.Title: refactor(material/progress-spinner): remove separate MatSpinner class
Issues.Body:
Having a separate MatSpinner class generates more code than necessary. 
We can omit the class by adding `mat-spinner` to the MatProgressSpinner selector and modifying the `mode` initialization.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(material/progress-spinner): remove separate MatSpinner class" (#20089)

#19980

Issues.Title: Optimize snack bar
Issues.Body:
Updates mdc-snack-bar-container to use a class-based adapter, which improves performance, just like in:
https://github.com/angular/components/pull/19980
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Optimize snack bar" (#20087)

Issues.Title: fix,perf(column-resize): Coalesce style updates along with sticky styler
Issues.Body:
Coalesces style updates triggered by the column resize system to trigger less layout thrashing. Also updates sticky column styles when resizing a column.

The net effect is a substantial improvement when applying min/max sizes at startup and a bit of a wash when actively resizing. The gains in active resize performance are mostly offset by the additional cost of recomputing sticky styles (but it was a bug before that they were not being recomputed). Should be much better for tables without sticky columns though.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix,perf(column-resize): Coalesce style updates along with sticky styler" (#20086)

Issues.Title: bug(MatTreeModule): Tree with checkboxes example - Reversed checkbox selected values when node has no child
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open Tree with checkboxes on StackBlitz https://stackblitz.com/angular/krgkldbxvgb?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftree-checklist-example.ts
2. Add  example: {}  to const TREE_DATA 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

The added node this.checklistSelection should be selected when the node is selected and should show not selected when the node is not selected.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

For the added node the selection values are reversed.
#### Environment

- Angular: 10
- CDK/Material: 10
- Browser(s): chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatTreeModule): Tree with checkboxes example - Reversed checkbox selected values when node has no child" (#20085)

and its configuration.

Issues.Title: refactor: expand private getter restrictions to underscored members
Issues.Body: We have a lint rule that doesn't allow private getters, because they increase the generated ES5 code without much benefit for a private API. These changes expand the restrictions to any public members that are prefixed with an underscore since we don't consider them part of the public API surface.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: expand private getter restrictions to underscored members" (#20083)

Issues.Title: bug(sort): Screenreaders not reading out current sort state
Issues.Body:
Basic sort example: https://stackblitz.com/angular/qmbrjdbmgdo?file=src%2Fapp%2Fsort-overview-example.ts

Using Chromevox, focus on a column header. Screenreader reports: "Fat (g) Button row 1 column 3 Fat (g) Press Search plus Space to activate)"

No mention of the current sort state. Was this a regression for the merged fix https://github.com/angular/components/pull/13297? Even when navigating across data cells I cannot get it to tell me how its sorted
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(sort): Screenreaders not reading out current sort state" (#20077)

Issues.Title: fix(select): use combobox pattern for accessibility
Issues.Body: Applies some of our recent learnings on how to handle the accessibility of a custom select to `mat-select`. Includes switching the trigger to be a `combobox` and the panel to a `listbox`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(select): use combobox pattern for accessibility" (#20082)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Table): Table examples don't fit the screen

#### Documentation Feedback

All `Table` examples go off the screen horizontally.

You can check the issue here:
https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples

version: 10.1.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(Table): Table examples don't fit the screen" (#20081)

Issues.Title: bug(MatInput): Placeholder of MatInput not showing inside mat-option without mat-label
Issues.Body:
The placeholder of MatInput elements don't display, when the input element is placed inside a mat-option in a mat-select and the surrounding mat-form-field does not have a label. This did not happen on Angular Material 10.0.x.

#### Reproduction

I couldn't reproduce it on StackBlitz, but I've set up a repo:
https://github.com/dsimon-onventis/angular-material-input-placeholder-issue

Basically you need the following HTML code to reproduce:

```html
<mat-form-field>
    <mat-select>
        <mat-option disabled>
            <input matInput placeholder="Search">
        </mat-option>
        <mat-option value="option1">Option 1</mat-option>
        <mat-option value="option2">Option 2</mat-option>
    </mat-select>
</mat-form-field>
```
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The placeholder of the MatInput element should be displayed:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68286501/88388726-5f4edd00-cdb5-11ea-949c-c2d7677cd7ba.png)


#### Actual Behavior

The placeholder of the MatInput element is not displayed:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68286501/88388765-71c91680-cdb5-11ea-803c-1c17525d234d.png)


#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.x
- CDK/Material: 10.1.0
- Browser(s): Chrome, Edge
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatInput): Placeholder of MatInput not showing inside mat-option without mat-label" (#20080)

Issues.Title: Tooltip fails to hide when changing component with component reuse
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
Stackblitz link:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/tooltip-stays-material

#### Steps to reproduce:

1. Have a component that is being reused have a tooltip on a button that navigates to a different component
1. Hover over button to display tooltip
2. Click button

#### Expected Behavior
The page should change and the tooltip should be hidden.

#### Actual Behavior
The tooltip stays visible. Also, when scrolling, after clicking the button and before the new component is loaded, the tooltip is no longer being updated and will stay even when moving the mouse away or scrolling.

#### Additional Information
The same behavior was reproduced with NG-ZORRO (https://github.com/NG-ZORRO/ng-zorro-antd/issues/5604), which makes me believe the issue lies within the overlay cdk.

#### Environment
Angular: 10.0.5 and 9.1.12
CDK: 10.1.0 and 9.2.4
Browser(s): Chrome and Firefox
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tooltip fails to hide when changing component with component reuse" (#20076)

Issues.Title: fix(clipboard): scroll position changing while copying on some browsers
Issues.Body:
The clipboard module works by creating a `textarea` dynamically, focusing it and copying its content. In order to prevent it from affecting the page layout, we put it at `-999em` off-screen, but the problem is that some browsers will try to move it into the view on focus by scrolling up.

These changes use `position: fixed` and anchor the textarea to the top of the page so vertically it's within the viewport.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(clipboard): scroll position changing while copying on some browsers" (#20073)

Issues.Title: feat(drag-drop): cdkConnectedTo finds all drop lists with the same ID, instead of only one
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

`CdkDropList` has `id` and `cdkConnectedTo` input properties to allow specifying an id or array of ids for which the drop lists should be connected.

The `id` input property "needs" to be unique, or better put is "assumed" to be unique - meaning when searching through drop lists to connect to by id, only the first match is returned.

Can the "need" for unique ids be removed and change the connected drop list logic to return **all** drop lists with a matching id?

From the user's perspective:

- If I want a drop list to inherently be standalone, provide a unique id.
- If I want a drop list to inherently be connected to others, provide a shared id.

#### Use Case

Connecting drop lists created dynamically, possibly defined in separate template files and with arbitrary DOM relation, **without** the overhead of having to maintain a separate list of all drop lists that should be connected, and making sure this list is properly updated and propagated to each drop list via change detection.

Instead a statically defined (or could be dynamic) id for the `id` and `cdkConnectedTo` inputs will automatically connect all the drop lists without any further coordination from the user.

Similar to what @sroettering mentioned [here](https://github.com/angular/components/pull/13754#issuecomment-436694651), but I don't think a new input property is necessary.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(drag-drop): cdkConnectedTo finds all drop lists with the same ID, instead of only one" (#20069)

Issues.Title: feat(stepper): Ability to display errors on steps that had no interaction
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I want to be able to trigger the step error manualy (changing the state of the step).

### Use Case

In a non-linear stepper, I can go to the last step, ignoring some steps (no interaction), and could submit my data even though the form (related with the uninterected step) is invalid.

### Reproduction 
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cxdumw

1) Click on the 3th step
2) Click on the 4th step
3) Click on Save

#### Current bahavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12090931/88175862-d55c1400-cbfc-11ea-9cfa-cabd67ee208d.png)

#### Expected behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12090931/88176058-1fdd9080-cbfd-11ea-9762-cc89a1382877.png)

### Observation
As a workaround to get my desired behavior, you can uncomment the `save()` function content and try the reproduction steps from above again.

`this.matStepper.steps.forEach(x => x.select());`

This way the [interacted property](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/cc1e0fe5964a23eeb4a68e9d090539cb9cdcc04b/tools/public_api_guard/cdk/stepper.d.ts#L15) is set to true, and error state is displayed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(stepper): Ability to display errors on steps that had no interaction" (#20068)
